title: Authors and Citation
text: Jaszowski L (2025). galisats: Configuration Jupiter's Four Largest Satellites. R package version 1.0.0, https://lechjaszowski.github.io/galilean_satellites/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {galisats: Configuration of Jupiter's Four Largest Satellites},   author = {Lech Jaszowski},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://lechjaszowski.github.io/galilean_satellites/}, }

what: Configuration of Jupiter's Four Largest Satellites
title: Configuration of Jupiter's Four Largest Satellites
text: looking Jupiter binoculars telescope don’t know moon , use package. galisats used determine positions four greatest satellites Jupiter (called Galilean satellites). Positions shown plot given time (ET – Ephemeris Time) respect planet, seen Earth. galsat() function calculates numerical values satellites’ positions: x – apparent rectangular coordinate satellite respect center Jupiter’s disk equatorial plane units Jupiter’s equatorial radius; X positive toward west y – apparent rectangular coordinate satellite respect center Jupiter’s disk equatorial plane units Jupiter’s equatorial radius; Y positive toward north function based algorithms book: Astronomical Formulae Calculators (4th edition), Jean Meeus, Willmann-Bell Inc., 1988

title: Configuration of Jupiter's Four Largest Satellites
Configuration of Jupiter's Four Largest Satellites
code: library(galisats) galsat(2025, 10, 13, 21, 40) #> [1] "SATELLITES OF JUPITER" #> [1] "Positions of the Galilean satellites." #> Date: 13 - 10 - 2025  #> Time [ET]: 21 : 40  #> [1] "x: West(+), East(-)" #> Io        4.1  #> Europa    -8.413  #> Ganymede  6.636  #> Callisto  -24.733  #> [1] "y: North(+), South(-)" #> Io        0.112  #> Europa    0.108  #> Ganymede  -0.352  #> Callisto  0.254 #>       moon          x          y #> 1       Io   4.099974  0.1122642 #> 2   Europa  -8.412734  0.1083234 #> 3 Ganymede   6.636258 -0.3519694 #> 4 Callisto -24.733044  0.2537935

what: Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
title: Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
text: galsat() used determine positions four greatest satellites Jupiter (called Galilean satellites). Positions shown plot given time (ET – Ephemeris Time) respect planet, seen Earth. galsat() function displays numerical values satellites’ positions: x – apparent rectangular coordinate satellite respect center Jupiter’s disk equatorial plane units Jupiter’s equatorial radius; X positive toward west y – apparent rectangular coordinate satellite respect center Jupiter’s disk equatorial plane units Jupiter’s equatorial radius; Y positive toward north

title: Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
text: year Type year (integer number greater equal 0). month Type month (integer number 1 12). day Type day (integer number 1 31). hour Type hour (integer number 0 23). minute Type minute (integer number 0 59).

title: Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
text: data.frame: 4 observations 3 variables: $ moon: chr "Io" "Europa" "Ganymede" "Callisto" $ x   : num $ y   : num Four rows - row position (x,y) one moon. Additionally, calculated positions moons displayed console, Plots pane shown graphically.

title: Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
text: function based algorithms book: Astronomical Formulae Calculators (4th edition), Jean Meeus, Willmann-Bell Inc., 1988

title: Calculate & draw the positions of the Galilean satellites — galsat
code: galsat(2025, 10, 13, 23, 30) #> [1] "SATELLITES OF JUPITER" #> [1] "Positions of the Galilean satellites." #> Date: 13 - 10 - 2025  #> Time [ET]: 23 : 30  #> [1] "x: West(+), East(-)" #> Io        2.816  #> Europa    -8.905  #> Ganymede  7.522  #> Callisto  -24.997  #> [1] "y: North(+), South(-)" #> Io        0.137  #> Europa    0.078  #> Ganymede  -0.339  #> Callisto  0.235   #>       moon          x           y #> 1       Io   2.815596  0.13686317 #> 2   Europa  -8.904947  0.07756843 #> 3 Ganymede   7.521977 -0.33942777 #> 4 Callisto -24.996779  0.23533560

title: galisats 0.1.0 (2025-07-01)
